alert.note: Alert for Menominee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 01 at 6:41AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Upper Michigan, including the following county, Menominee. * WHEN...Until 845 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 535 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. As much as 2 to 3 inches of rain has fallen since 2 AM CDT. - Although showers and thunderstorms are diminishing, additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience minor flooding include... Stephenson, Cedar River, Bagley, Daggett, Ingalls, Swanson, Banat, Arthur Bay, Wells State Park and Nathan. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
